lead_paragraph: Michael Hill was named general manager of the Florida Marlins yesterday, replacing Larry Beinfest, who became president of baseball operations.The Marlins also named Dan Jennings and Jim Fleming as assistant general managers, adding to their roles in the team’s player personnel and development departments. Hill, Beinfest, Jennings and Fleming all accepted extensions, keeping them under contract for at least the next eight seasons.Beinfest was named the Marlins’ general manager before the 2002 season and helped Florida put together the team that won the World Series in 2003. Hill becomes the third general manager in Marlins history. He had been an assistant general manager under Beinfest since 2002.
